intro: Mariscus gayi, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous species that thrives in sandy, well-drained soils along the shoreline. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom during the winter months.
